newsitem.title: NIGER: US resumes aid to Niger.
newsitem.headline: US resumes aid to Niger.

text.p: The United States is to give Niger seven billion CFA francs ($12 million) in aid over the next two years, Charles Cecil, the U.S. ambassador to the West African country said on Wednesday.

The United States cut back on its aid programme in Niger after a military coup in January 1996 and suspended all aid in July of that year when military ruler Ibrahim Bare Mainassara won a presidential election after scrapping the electoral commission in the middle of the poll.
The U.S. aid will be used in the fields of mother and child health, food hygiene, the promotion of democracy and human rights, Cecil said. ($ = 580 CFA francs)
